subject: Gardening
title: Cover Crops as Living Mulch
description: A quick, practical guide to Cover Crops as Living Mulch.

hook.text: Bare soil is vulnerable soil. Living plants covering the ground between crops protect it like a living blanket.

buildup.text: Cover crops like clover and vetch grow between main crops, suppressing weeds and retaining moisture.

discovery.text: Living mulch reduces soil temperature by up to 10Â°F in summer, keeping roots cool during heat waves.

twist.text: The cover crop competes for water. Managing it requires mowing or choosing low-vigor varieties that coexist.

climax.text: Living mulch is companion planting at its most practicalâ€”ground cover that works while your main crop grows above it.

punchline.text: The best mulch is alive, growing, and feeding the soil.

quiz.question: What is the main challenge of using living mulch between crops?
options: Living mulch attracts more pests than bare soil
The cover crop competes for water and must be managed to avoid dominating
Living mulch prevents rainwater from reaching crop roots
